content: dfw yc hat if you love color noro has to be at top of the list for effortlessly blending dozens of shades into spectacular results this simple beanie does just that materials 2 skeins noro kureyon in contrasting colorways try light and dark or bright and muted together 50g 110 yds each label yarns a & b size 7 & 8 16 circular needles and size 8 dpn or longer circular for decreasing the top using magic loop skill level intermediate sized for womens xs / teen womens med / mens small womens large / mens medium mens large to fit a 21 22 23 24 head hat has negative ease and will stretch to fit head abbreviations co = cast on preferably german twisted or long tail ssk = slip slip knit 2 sts just slipped together p2tog = purl 2 sts together using the size 7 needle and the first skein of kureyon a co 84 88 92 96 sts k1 row then join to knit in the round being careful not to twist and knit another row around place marker to denote beginning of round start rib pattern change to size 8 needles when choosing which end of yarn b to start with chose the highest contrast with a make sure to carry yarn not used loosely in back so hat will lay flat rnds 1 6 k2 with a p2 with b around rnds 7 12 p2 with a k2 with b around round 13 to length k2 with a p2 with b around work in rib pattern as established until length measures 6 5 6 5 7 7 5 from beginning letting first few row roll decrease for crown round 1 k2 with a p2tog with b around rnds 2 4 k2 with a p with b around switch to dpn or magic loop when necessary round 5 ssk with a p with b around rnds 6 7 k with a p with b around break off b rnds 8 10 ssk around with a pull yarn through sts at end draw close and work in yarn ends a design by diane piwko * 200 mckinney st * farmersville tx 75442 * 972-782-6630 * www fibercircleyarn com copyright 2018 all rights reserved
